article:
Here are some of the more commonly known problems that are NP-complete when
expressed as decision problems. This list is in no way comprehensive (there are
more than 3000 known NP-complete problems). Most of the problems in this list
are taken from Garey and Johnson's seminal book Computers and Intractability: A
Guide to the Theory of NP-Completeness, and are here presented in the same order
and organization.
